alert.note: Alert for Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Hanford - Corcoran - Lemoore (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:41PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kings and western Tulare Counties through 515 PM PST... At 439 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Corcoran, or 21 miles southwest of Tulare, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. Possible cold air funnel clouds. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corcoran and Alpaugh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
